data.enText: very small pieces of stone or sand

data.chText: 我眼睛里进了一粒沙子。
data.enText: I had a piece of grit in my eye.

data.chText: 他们在结冰的路上撒沙子和盐。
data.enText: They were spreading grit and salt on the icy roads.
the courage and determination that makes it possible for sb to continue doing sth difficult or unpleasant

data.chText: （在结冰的路上）撒沙砾，撒盐，撒沙子
data.enText: to spread grit , salt or sand on a road that is covered with ice
to bite your teeth tightly together
She gritted her teeth against the pain.
‘Stop it!’ he said through gritted teeth.
to be determined to continue to do sth in a difficult or unpleasant situation

data.chText: 雨开始大起来，可我们鼓起勇气继续进行。
data.enText: It started to rain harder, but we gritted our teeth and carried on.

means: (在结冰的路上)撒沙砾，撒盐，撒沙子

data.enText: to bite your teeth tightly together
She gritted her teeth against the pain.
‘Stop it!’ he said through gritted teeth.
to be determined to continue to do sth in a difficult or unpleasant situation

data.chText: 雨开始大起来，可我们鼓起勇气继续进行。
data.enText: It started to rain harder, but we gritted our teeth and carried on.

example: he didn't have the guts to try it

value.def: Grit is very small pieces of stone. It is often put on roads in winter to make them less slippery.

example.ex: He felt tiny bits of grit and sand peppering his knees.
example.tran: 他感到细小的沙砾不断打在膝盖上。

value.def: If someone has grit, they have the determination and courage to continue doing something even though it is very difficult.

example.ex: You've got to admire her grit.
example.tran: 你不得不佩服她的勇气。

value.def: Grits are coarsely ground grains of corn which are cooked and eaten for breakfast or as part of a meal in the southern United States.
value.tran: 粗玉米粉，玉米渣（美国南部常食用）

value.def: If you grit your teeth, you press your upper and lower teeth tightly together, usually because you are angry about something.

example.ex: Gritting my teeth, I did my best to stifle one or two remarks...
example.tran: 我咬紧牙关，硬是吞回了几句话。

example.ex: 'It is clear that my client has been less than frank with me,' said his lawyer, through gritted teeth.
example.tran: “我的当事人显然没有告诉我实情，”他的律师咬牙切齿地说道。

value.tran: （通常指因愤怒而）咬紧牙关，咬牙切齿

value.def: If you grit your teeth, you make up your mind to carry on even if the situation is very difficult.

example.ex: There is going to be hardship, but we have to grit our teeth and get on with it.
example.tran: 未来会很艰难，但是我们必须咬牙坚持下去。
